roleset.name: assign/identify the price of, cf cost
roleset.note: PRICE-V NOTES: Member of VNcls price-54.4. (from price.01-v)
PRICE-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry price.01, OntoNotes sense groupings price.01, price.02; maps to VN entry price 54.4. Framed by Claire. (from price.01-n)

example.name: straight
example.text: Continental Cablevision priced $350 million of junk bonds at par.

example.name: passive
example.text: The 30-year issue was priced at a spread of 57 basis points
example.arg: at a spread of 57 basis points

example.name: with purpose clause
example.text: Serial bonds are priced at par to yield 6.40% in 1991

example.name: passive with purpose
example.text: These cars are priced to sell!

example.name: with PRD, arg3
example.text: [Some nations *ICH*-2]-3 will be priced [*-3]out , most likely the relatively undeveloped countries in which automotive transportation is not really essential]-2 .

example.name: With seller and commodity
example.text: As the good times rolled they more than doubled their prices forpulp , a raw material used in all sorts of paper , to $ 830 ametric ton this past spring from $ 380 a ton at the start of 1986.
example.arg: for pulp , a raw material used in all sorts of paper ,

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: The price of gasoline has soared in recent months.

example.name: Metaphorical price
example.text: John has paid a high price for his risky life style.

example.name: More metaphorical price
example.text: The army is paying a significant price in casualties to occupy the city.

roleset.name: price_out: assign/identify prices for
roleset.note: PRICE_OUT-V NOTES: See VNcls price-54.4. (from price.02-v)

example.name: with LOC
example.text: I simply wrote down the ingredients that they used and priced it out at Costco (non organic) and the market (organic) and couldn't beat the price.
example.arg: at Costco (non organic) and the market (organic)

example.name: All args
example.text: I was all set to make a fancy white picket fence with a gate and a trellis...which sounded nice until I priced it out at $350 .
